page.title: 17LAND RECLAMATION SCHEME
page.content: Seventy years ago Cwmclydach was a thriving mining community with more than 5000 men employed in the Cambrian ,Cwmclydach,Blaenclydach and Old Dinas Collieries. They were gaseous mines and in 1965, 35 miners were killed in an explosion forcing the N.C.B. to close Cambrian. The N.C.B. have sold the Site to the District Council and it is being land- scaped as part of a National Land Reclamation Scheme. The Welsh Devel- opment Agency is financing the Scheme which will cost Â£2,500000. Work began in Jan.1985 and is to be completed in 1987. The area is being flattened with removed tips filling in valleys to provide space for two lakes, two housing areas, factory units, five recreational areas, a school and an allotment area. A Mid-Rhondda access road is being built to link with M4.
